meanings.definition: The act of cutting out or removing a part of something, especially in surgery.
meanings.sent1: During the surgery, the doctor performed multiple resections to remove the tumor.
meanings.sent2: The resections of the damaged tissue were necessary to improve the patient's health.
meanings.sent3: The resections of the cake slices were so precise that everyone got an equal piece.
meanings.sent4: She skillfully performed resections on the fabric, creating a beautiful quilt.
meanings.sent5: The resections of the weeds from the garden made it look neat and tidy.

meanings.definition: The process of dividing a figure into smaller parts, especially in mathematics.
meanings.sent1: In geometry class, we learned about the resections of shapes to calculate their areas.
meanings.sent2: The resections of the rectangle into squares helped us understand the concept better.
meanings.sent3: The resections of the pizza slices were so uneven that everyone had a good laugh.
meanings.sent4: She explained the resections of the circle as dividing it into equal sectors like a pie.
meanings.sent5: The resections of the map into grids made it easier to navigate the terrain.
